column4: I'm having problems with my connection. Under Vista, everything seems to work fine. Under Ubuntu (8.10), normal surfing works fine, but when I try to do interactive stuff (gmail, facebook, banking, posting forum messages) things don't work properly. It takes ages to submit form and then nothing happens, etc. I've talked to my ISP and he said they're not doing anything special and that if it works under Vista it should work on Ubuntu. So what
can be the problem?
i am fixing a pc and have the exact same problem as you are
Really? Any success?
Go to applications, add/remove and look for epiphanny
It's not installed
install it
did you install Epiphanny
maverick340: Okay, other browser works great!
maverick340: At least for the first few things I'm trying
maverick340, Actionparsnip1: I renamed the folder and things still don't work properly. I think I'll reinstall.
maverick340, Actionparsnip1: Reinstalled firefox, didn't help
maverick340, Actionparsnip1: I'm keeping the conf file aside so we could work with a fresh clean copy
Where can I get firefox 2.0 from? It doesn't appear in my synaptic...
get it in add/remove
We've already tried another web browser. the problem is with firefox...
Or is there some other reason?
are you on skype?
Do you mean if I have a skype user, or whether I'm using skype atm?
i mean are you on skype and you can talk now
I am on skype, but my mics not working properly
